snippet: Allowing companies to export cellphones and laptops could frustrate censorship and send a message that America stands with the Iranian people.
abstract: Editorial praises Obama administration for lifting sanctions on companies that want to sell cellphones, laptops, encryption software and other similar technology to ordinary Iranians; holds policy shift should improve ability of Iranians to circumvent their government's unrelenting crackdown on dissenting opinion and to communicate with each other and outside world.
lead_paragraph: Allowing companies to export cellphones and laptops could frustrate censorship and send a message that America stands with the Iranian people.

headline.seo: The U.S. Makes a Smart Change in Its Iran Policy
headline.main: A Smart Change in Iran Policy
headline.print_headline: A Smart Change in Iran Policy
